title: Hunter Passage 42
text:
The Hunter Passage 42 is an American <a href="sailboat">sailboat</a> that was designed by the <a href="Hunter%20Design%20Team">Hunter Design Team</a> as a cruiser and first built in 1989.
The Passage 42 may be confused with the unrelated 2016 42-foot sailboat design, the <a href="Marlow-Hunter%2042SS">Marlow-Hunter 42SS</a>.
Production.
The design was built by <a href="Hunter%20Marine">Hunter Marine</a> in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a> from 1989 to 1997, but it is now out of production.
Design.
The Hunter Passage 42 is a recreational <a href="keelboat">keelboat</a>, built predominantly of <a href="fiberglass">fiberglass</a>. It has a <a href="B%26amp%3BR%20rig">B&R</a> <a href="masthead%20sloop">masthead sloop</a> rig, a center cockpit, a <a href="raked%20stem">raked stem</a>, a walk-through <a href="reverse%20transom">reverse transom</a> with a swimming platform and folding ladder, an internally mounted spade-type <a href="rudder">rudder</a> controlled by a <a href="Ship%27s%20wheel">wheel</a> and a fixed <a href="wing%20keel">wing keel</a>. It displaces and carries of ballast.
The boat has a draft of with the standard wing keel fitted.
The boat is fitted with a Japanese <a href="Yanmar">Yanmar</a> 4JH2TE <a href="diesel%20engine">diesel engine</a> of . The fuel tank holds and the fresh water tank has a capacity of .
Factory standard equipment included a 130% <a href="roller%20furling">roller furling</a> <a href="Genoa%20%28sail%29">genoa</a>, dual two-speed self tailing winches, <a href="marine%20VHF%20radio">marine VHF radio</a>, <a href="knotmeter">knotmeter</a>, <a href="depth%20sounder">depth sounder</a>, AM/FM radio and <a href="CD%20player">CD player</a> with eight speakers, <a href="anchor">anchor</a> <a href="teak">teak</a> and <a href="holly">holly</a> cabin sole, fully enclosed <a href="Head%20%28watercraft%29">head</a> with shower, private forward and aft cabins, with bedding, a dinette table that converts to a berth, <a href="microwave%20oven">microwave oven</a>, dual sinks, three-burner <a href="gimbal">gimbal</a>ed <a href="liquid%20petroleum%20gas">liquid petroleum gas</a> stove and oven and <a href="life%20jacket">life jacket</a>s. Factory options included <a href="roller%20furling">in mast mainsail furling</a>, <a href="air%20conditioning">air conditioning</a>, electric halyard winch and leather cushions. It has of below-decks headroom.
The design has a <a href="hull%20speed">hull speed</a> of .
Operational history.
In a 2010 review, yacht broker Richard Jordan noted the design and space below decks, "down below showcases the strengths of Hunter. The interior layout with centerline queen aft and a saloon you could yoga in is what every cruiser lusts for." In addressing detractors, he stated, "some stuffy sailors will without thought disparage these yachts despite their advantages."
